results.title: Authenticity (Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy)
results.snippet: The term ‘authentic’ is used either in the strong sense of being “of undisputed origin or authorship”, or in a weaker sense of being “faithful to an original” or a “reliable, accurate representation”. To say that something is authentic is to say that it is what it professes ...

results.title: Authenticity > Notes (Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy)
results.snippet: 1. It should be noted that there is a disagreement in the literature whether or not Heidegger should be counted as an existentialist. In many ways, much depends on whether one uses the term existentialism in a narrow or more general manner. In a narrow sense, only Sartre and Beauvoir would ...
